note.en:
‚öôÔ∏è **Relative pronouns** connect two clauses and avoid repetition. They refer to a previously mentioned noun (the antecedent).

üîπ **QUE** (that, which, who) ‚Üí most common
- Used for **people and things**
- Can be subject or object
‚û°Ô∏è *El libro que leo es interesante.* (The book that I'm reading is interesting.)
‚û°Ô∏è *La chica que habla es mi hermana.* (The girl who is speaking is my sister.)

üîπ **QUIEN / QUIENES** (who, whom) ‚Üí only for people
- Used **after a preposition** (a, con, de, para, por, etc.)
‚û°Ô∏è *La persona con quien hablo es mi profesor.* (The person with whom I'm speaking is my teacher.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Los amigos a quienes invit√© llegaron tarde.* (The friends whom I invited arrived late.)

üîπ **DONDE** (where) ‚Üí for places
‚û°Ô∏è *La ciudad donde vivo es grande.* (The city where I live is big.)
‚û°Ô∏è *El restaurante donde comimos era bueno.* (The restaurant where we ate was good.)

üîπ **LO QUE** (what, that which) ‚Üí abstract idea or complete sentence
‚û°Ô∏è *No entiendo lo que dices.* (I don't understand what you're saying.)
‚û°Ô∏è *Lo que me gusta es viajar.* (What I like is traveling.)

üîπ **CUAL / CUALES** (which)
- Used **with article** (el cual, la cual, los cuales, las cuales)
- More formal, often after preposition
‚û°Ô∏è *La empresa para la cual trabajo es grande.* (The company for which I work is big.)

üîπ **CUYO / CUYA / CUYOS / CUYAS** (whose)
- Indicates **possession**
- Agrees with **the possessed object**, not the possessor
‚û°Ô∏è *El autor cuyo libro le√≠ es famoso.* (The author whose book I read is famous.)
‚û°Ô∏è *La casa cuyas ventanas est√°n rotas es vieja.* (The house whose windows are broken is old.)

üí° **Important notes:**

- **QUE** NEVER has an accent (except in questions: *¬øQu√©?*)
- After preposition:
  - **People** ‚Üí *quien/quienes* or *el/la/los/las que*
  - **Things** ‚Üí *el/la/los/las que* or *el/la cual, los/las cuales*

‚ö†Ô∏è **Difference QUE vs QUIEN:**
- Without preposition ‚Üí **QUE** (people and things)
  ‚û°Ô∏è *El chico que vive aqu√≠.* (The boy who lives here.)
- With preposition + person ‚Üí **QUIEN** (or *el/la que*)
  ‚û°Ô∏è *El chico con quien vivo.* (The boy with whom I live.)

‚û°Ô∏è *Mi amigo, cuya hermana es m√©dica, vive en Madrid.* (My friend, whose sister is a doctor, lives in Madrid.)
